1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

2.text: If one assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?

3.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, And thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

4.text: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, And thou hast made firm the feeble knees.

5.text: But now it is come unto thee, and thou faintest; It toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.

6.text: Is not thy fear of God thy confidence, And the integrity of thy ways thy hope?

7.text: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?

8.text: According as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, And sow trouble, reap the same.

9.text: By the breath of God they perish, And by the blast of his anger are they consumed.

10.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, And the teeth of the young lions, are broken.

11.text: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, And the whelps of the lioness are scattered abroad.

12.text: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, And mine ear received a whisper thereof.

13.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, When deep sleep falleth on men,

14.text: Fear came upon me, and trembling, Which made all my bones to shake.

15.text: Then a spirit passed before my face; The hair of my flesh stood up.

16.text: It stood still, but I could not discern the appearance thereof; A form was before mine eyes: There was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,

17.text: Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?

18.text: Behold, he putteth no trust in his servants; And his angels he chargeth with folly:

19.text: How much more them that dwell in houses of clay, Whose foundation is in the dust, Who are crushed before the moth!

20.text: Betwixt morning and evening they are destroyed: They perish for ever without any regarding it.

21.text: Is not their tent-cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom.
